data.title: Sophie Brandenburg
data.meta_description: Sophie of Brandenburg  was a Princess of Brandenburg and by marriage Electress of Saxony.
data.text:
Career

On 25 April 1582 in Dresden, Sophie married Elector Christian I of Saxony (1560–1591). In allusion to the pious widow Judith in the Book of Judith, the orthodox Lutherans thereafter celebrated her as "Judith of Saxony". As a widow, Sophie lived in the so-called "Fraumutterhaus" in Dresden or in Castle Colditz.

She had her own gold coins ("Sophie ducats", Sophiendukaten) minted.

She also had the old Franciscan church in Dresden again readied for divine service (1599–1610), which after her was called the Sophienkirche. The "Duchess"s Garden" (Der Herzogin Garten) also takes its name from Duchess Sophie.

She died at Colditz Castle. Franz Blanckmeister: Kurfürstin Anna Sophie von Sachsen: eine evangelische Bekennerin, Barmen Franz Otto Stichart: Galerie der Sächsischen Fürstinnen.

Biogr. Skizzen sämmtl.

Ahnfrauen daughter Königl. Hauses Sachsen. Quellengemäß dargest., Leipzig 1857 Ute Essegern: Fürstinnen am kursächsischen Hof, Leipziger Universitätsverlag, 2007.
